q: Allen Iverson 's Robert Horrygest assist to Chris Webber didn't come on a no-look pass. It came in words of encouragement to PTyrone Hilly's slumping newcomer.`` Just get your swagger back,'' Chris Webber said Allen Iverson told him. That's really what I did. It helped me out. Chris Webber had his best performance in his four games with Philadelphia, scoring 24 points and grabShaquille O'Nealg 12 rebounds, and Allen Iverson added 31 points to lead the 76ers to a 98-89 win over the James Cleveland Cavaliers on Friday night

to encourage Laurent Gbagbo to step down from a presidency that isn't his. In November the Jim West African state held elections and despite polls showing Alassane Ouattara Outtara as the victor, Mr. Gbagbo is still in power. In addition to Ivory Coast's neighbors, the UN, US and EU all back Gbabgo's rival Alassane Ouattara Outtara as winner of the Jim West African state's presidential election. Nearly 200 people have been killed in post-election violence with fears that political standoff could tip Ivory Coast back into civil war. Fears of violence have led 14000 people from both political sides to flee the country into neighboring Liberia, and the United Nations estimates total refugees figures may be closer to 30000. Fatoumata Lejune-Kaba, UNHCR`` We are

Adam Price said it was mentioned on the front page of the newspaper and was branded exclusive. He said it was astonishing that Andy Coulson did not remember it. . Alyse Eady performed her musical ventriloquist act,`` I Want to Be a Cowboy's Sweetheart,'' for the pageant crowd. Her platform in the Miss Arkansas and Miss America pageants highlighted the issue of Developing Leaders: Boys& Girls Clubs of America. Since the pageant, Alyse Eady , 22, has continued to be presented to the public with appearances scheduled on Late Show With David Letterman and Inside Edition on CBS and on the MSNBC cable news network.

not supporting a troop surge in Iraq. At no point did the former Democratic operative admit that some in the media, including reporters at ABC, were skeptical of such a surge. George Stephanopoulos chided, So, can you now concede what Senator McCain said last week was correct? That had you stayed in office, there would have been defeat in Iraq and the surge would not have taken place? George Stephanopoulos asserted that individuals such as then-ambassador to Iraq Paul Bremer called for a surge. The host argued,`` It's documented in Bob Woodward 's book.'' Donald Rumsfeld retorted,`` Bob Woodward wasn't there.''
